column4: Anybody that's been able to set up Ubuntu as a wireless access point?
it's possible, depends mostly on the wireless card
I've got an Atheros. Actually, it works now, except I can't figure out how to turn on WEP
Do you know about setting up /etc/networking/interfaces? I think the problem must be there.
yes, but you don't need to worry about it
thanks, I've done some of what's explained in that document, but there's no discussion of WEP -- that's where I'm stuck
i don't know what to say on that regard :(
at least you can add yourself to the small list of people who actually pulled of the tricky 'Master Mode'
heh, yeah but don't ask how long it took me to get that far ;)
i would have just used a cheap wireless router ;)
and set it up in 'switch mode'
to piggy back off my desktop's network on the other interface
